study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the molecular mechanism of chromium (Cr) chelation by combined treatment with selenium (Se) and molybdenum (Mo) in plants, focusing on cell wall composition and transcriptome changes.
results_summary: The study found that Se-Mo interactions increased pectin, cellulose, and lignin content in plant cell walls, enhancing Cr chelation ability. Upregulation of genes involved in polysaccharide and lignin biosynthesis contributed to these effects.
population_specificity: Plants (specific species not mentioned in the abstract)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the reproductive toxicity of Molybdenum (Mo) and Cadmium (Cd) co-exposure in sheep testes, focusing on the ROS/NLRP3 inflammasome pathway.
results_summary: Mo and Cd co-exposure caused histopathological damage, reduced BTB-related protein levels, increased oxidative stress and inflammation, and induced reproductive toxicity in sheep testes. Treatment with ROS scavengers or NLRP3 inflammasome inhibitors mitigated these adverse effects.
population_specificity: Healthy male sheep

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the photocatalytic and antibacterial performance of a novel MoS2/SnO2 (MS) nano-heterojunction for pollutant removal and wastewater treatment.
results_summary: The MS nano-heterojunction demonstrated superior photocatalytic degradation (97.6% in 100 min for CIP removal and 92.5% in 60 min for Cr (VI) reduction) and near 100% antibacterial efficiency against E. coli within 10 min.
population_specificity: Not specified (laboratory study, no human or animal subjects mentioned).
effective_dosage: Not specified (material synthesis described as "facile hydrothermal process").
study_duration: Not specified (performance measured at specific time points: 10, 60, and 100 min).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of molybdenum (Mo) and different sources of copper (Cu) and sulfur (S) on performance, carcass traits, and blood mineral concentrations in lambs.
results_summary: Molybdenum supplementation increased its blood concentration but reduced serum Cu levels. Organic sources of Cu and S showed some benefits in serum mineral concentrations, but no clear pattern emerged in performance or carcass traits.
population_specificity: Forty male non-castrated crossbred Dorper x Santa Inês lambs (20 ± 1.2 kg body weight, 90 ± 2 days old).
effective_dosage: 10 mg Mo/kg DM, 10 mg Cu/kg DM, and 2000 mg S/kg DM.
interactions: Mo reduced serum Cu concentration; organic Cu and S increased serum S concentration.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to understand the biological effects and uptake mechanisms of molybdenum nanoparticles (Mo NPs) on tobacco seedlings under different application methods (foliar vs. root irrigation).
results_summary: Mo NPs improved agronomic attributes, water and sugar content, and photosynthetic rate in tobacco seedlings, especially with root irrigation. They also induced root cell lignification, increased vascular bundles, and activated genes related to photosynthesis and aquaporin processes. However, a concentration-dependent increase in malonaldehyde (MDA) and defensive enzyme activity was observed.
population_specificity: Tobacco seedlings (Nicotiana tabacum L.)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a metallic molybdenum selenide (n-MoSe2) nanozyme with enhanced catalytic sensitivity for tumor therapy, focusing on electron transfer and photothermal conversion.
results_summary: The study found that n-MoSe2 exhibited ultrasensitive H2O2 responses, enhanced peroxidase-like activity, and broad absorption for photothermal conversion, significantly improving therapeutic effects under NIR laser irradiation.
population_specificity: Tumor microenvironment (in vitro/in vivo, specific population not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate MoN@PEG as an efficient nitric oxide (NO) donor for cancer therapy, assessing its release mechanism, therapeutic efficacy, and potential for synergistic treatment with sonodynamic therapy (SDT).
results_summary: MoN@PEG demonstrated sensitive NO release triggered by the tumor microenvironment, achieving high atomic utilization (94.1 ± 5.6 μM). It also acted as a peroxidase and sonosensitizer, with enhanced SDT effects when combined with Pt, leading to prominent antitumor efficiency and immune response activation.
population_specificity: Not specified (likely preclinical, in vitro or animal models).
study_duration: Degradation and elimination monitored over 14 days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether an Ag-modified Z-scheme TiO2/Bi2MoO6 heterojunction could enhance photocatalytic degradation and disinfection efficiency under visible light.
results_summary: The catalyst significantly improved degradation efficiency of tetracycline hydrochloride (TC-HCl) and ciprofloxacin (CIP) by 459% and 512%, respectively, and effectively inactivated E. coli and inhibited S. albus growth. The study also identified potential degradation pathways and photocatalytic mechanisms.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro study on photocatalytic materials and bacterial inactivation).
effective_dosage: Not specified (material composition described as TiO2/Bi2MoO6/Ag-45).
study_duration: 100 minutes for degradation, 200 minutes for disinfection.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how molybdenum (Mo) application affects phosphorus (P) availability to plants by examining root morphology, uptake, and molecular responses under different P levels.
results_summary: Mo application increased soybean biomass, lateral root formation, and P uptake, particularly under normal P conditions. At low P, Mo enhanced root organic acid secretion and acid phosphatase activity, improving soil P conversion.
population_specificity: Soybean plants
effective_dosage: Low P (5 μmol), Normal P (500 μmol)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential protective effects of molybdenum and its nanoparticles against anticancer chemotherapy-induced toxicity by targeting oxidative stress-mediated pathways.
results_summary: The study suggests that molybdenum, along with other trace elements, may counteract chemotherapy-induced toxicity by inhibiting oxidative stress pathways and upregulating protective signaling mechanisms, though its specific impact on efficacy remains unclear.
population_specificity: Cancer patients undergoing anticancer chemotherapy (ACT).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess heavy metal pollution, including Molybdenum (Mo), in the Awash River basin and identify its sources.
results_summary: The study found high levels of Molybdenum (116.7 μg/L) in the Awash River, with 20% of analyzed heavy metals exceeding WHO limits for drinking water, including Mo (103.8 μg/L) at certain sites. Anthropogenic activities and geological processes were identified as primary sources of contamination.
population_specificity: Surface water samples from 21 stations in the Awash River basin, Ethiopia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of UV irradiation on the shear bond strength between PMMA and a Co-Cr-Mo alloy.
results_summary: UV treatment increased the hydrophilic characteristics of the alloy surface and significantly improved bond strength with PMMA compared to non-treated groups. Surface roughness remained unchanged, but oxidation enhanced bonding efficacy.
population_specificity: Not specified (laboratory study on materials).
effective_dosage: UV treatment times of 0, 15, and 30 minutes.

study_goal: The researchers were investigating the potential of molybdenum disulfide (MoS₂) nanomaterials as drug delivery systems and therapeutic agents in cancer treatment.
results_summary: The study emphasized the role of structure and shape in mediating drug loading and release, suggesting that MoS₂ nanomaterials could be effective in cancer therapy. However, specific efficacy results or clinical outcomes were not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Not specified (likely preclinical or in vitro studies based on context).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of friction versus frictionless mechanics (using titanium molybdenum alloy wires) on incisor position and root resorption during anterior segment retraction.
results_summary: Both friction and frictionless mechanics showed statistically significant changes in incisor position and root resorption, but the differences between the two methods were not clinically significant. Root resorption was slightly more pronounced with frictionless mechanics.
population_specificity: Thirty female patients aged 13-18 years with bimaxillary protrusion.
effective_dosage: Not specified (mechanical force of 160 g/side applied).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to highlight the diagnostic challenges and importance of MRI in identifying molybdenum cofactor deficiency type A (MoCD-A) caused by MOCS1 gene mutations.
results_summary: The study reported a case of MoCD-A with severe cerebral damage detected via MRI, confirmed by genetic analysis, and emphasized the need for early diagnosis and genetic counseling. It also reviewed clinical and neuroimaging features of 25 newborns with MoCD-A from existing literature.
population_specificity: Newborns with MoCD-A (specifically a male newborn in the case report) and a review of 25 documented cases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the latest advances in molybdenum-containing enzymes and their clinical significance, particularly in liver pathologies.
results_summary: The study found that molybdenum-containing enzymes like xanthine oxidase, aldehyde oxidases, sulfite oxidase, and mitochondrial amidoxime-reducing component play critical roles in metabolic homeostasis, drug metabolism, and liver pathologies, with potential diagnostic and therapeutic applications. Elevated activity of these enzymes is linked to conditions such as NAFLD and HCC, while their inhibition may impact drug effectiveness and liver health.
population_specificity: Human physiology and disease pathology, particularly liver dysfunction.

study_goal: The researchers were attempting to describe the discovery timeline of the mitochondrial amidoxime-reducing component (mARC), a molybdoenzyme in humans.
results_summary: The abstract briefly mentions the timeline of mARC's discovery but does not provide specific findings about Molybdenum's effects.
population_specificity: Not specified

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review neuroimaging and genetic aspects of sulfite oxidase deficiency (SOD) and molybdenum cofactor deficiency (MoCD) to aid early diagnosis and differentiate them from similar conditions.
results_summary: The study summarized neuroimaging features (e.g., cerebral atrophy, encephalomalacia) and genetic mechanisms of SOD and MoCD, emphasizing their diagnostic importance and distinguishing them from neonatal hypoxic-ischemic encephalopathy and Leigh syndrome.
population_specificity: Infants with SOD or MoCD and related neurometabolic disorders.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the biomechanical wear properties and particle size characteristics of a vitamin E-enhanced highly cross-linked polyethylene (VEXPE) glenoid compared to a conventional ultrahigh-molecular-weight polyethylene (UHMWPE) glenoid against a cobalt chromium molybdenum (CoCrMo) head component.
results_summary: The VEXPE glenoid showed significantly lower wear rates and improved functional biologic activity (FBA) compared to conventional UHMWPE, indicating reduced osteolytic potential. The study demonstrated superior pristine and abrasive wear properties for VEXPE.
population_specificity: Anatomic shoulder arthroplasty models (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the progress, properties, applications, and challenges of 2D materials, including molybdenum disulfide, in photothermal therapy (PTT) for cancer treatment.
results_summary: The study highlighted molybdenum disulfide's potential for PTT due to its high photothermal conversion efficiency, biocompatibility, and stability, but noted challenges restricting its clinical use.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare cement penetration and clinical performance between PEEK and traditional cobalt chromium molybdenum (CoCrMo) prostheses during total knee arthroplasty (TKA).
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in bone cement penetration, clinical outcomes (KSS, VAS scores), complications, or survivorship between PEEK and CoCrMo prostheses at 1 year postoperatively.
population_specificity: 48 patients undergoing TKA, randomized into PEEK (n=24) and CoCrMo (n=24) groups.
effective_dosage: Not specified (implants used, not a supplement).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the use of inorganic nanoscaffolds, including those involving transition metal catalysts like Molybdenum, for bioorthogonal pro-drug activation in targeted therapeutic applications.
results_summary: The study highlights that inorganic nanoscaffolds can protect and solubilize transition metal catalysts, enabling localized pro-drug activation with minimized off-target effects, and suggests potential for enzyme-like bioorthogonal processes.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro and in vivo applications discussed in a review context).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of drug-drug interactions between azathioprine (AZA) and aldehyde oxidase (AO) inhibitors, a molybdenum-containing enzyme, on hematologic and hepatic disorders.
results_summary: The study found that concomitant use of AO inhibitors (e.g., chlorpromazine, clozapine, hydralazine, quetiapine) increased signals for AZA-induced adverse effects, suggesting potential inhibition of AZA metabolism via AO. The clinical importance of AO as a drug-metabolizing enzyme remains understudied.
population_specificity: Patients reported in the U.S. Food and Drug Administration Adverse Event Reporting System and the Japanese Adverse Drug Event Report database.
interactions: AO inhibitors (chlorpromazine, clozapine, hydralazine, quetiapine) may inhibit AZA metabolism.

study_goal: The researchers were attempting to determine the molecular cause and metabolic consequences of Molybdenum cofactor deficiency (MoCD), specifically focusing on sulfite oxidase (SOX) activity loss.
results_summary: The study found that MoCD results in the loss of SOX activity, leading to toxic sulfite accumulation, increased metabolites like S-sulfocysteine and thiosulfate, and decreased cysteine and cystine levels.
population_specificity: Neonatal-onset patients with myoclonic epileptic encephalopathy and dystonia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of molybdenum disulfide (MoS₂) as a nanomaterial-based antibacterial agent to combat bacterial infections.
results_summary: The study suggests that molybdenum disulfide exhibits antibacterial properties due to its large surface area, high biocompatibility, strong NIR absorption, and low cytotoxicity, making it a promising alternative to conventional antibiotics.
population_specificity: Not specified (general bacterial infection context).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of molybdenum (Mo) and tungsten (W) as materials for biodegradable electronic components in transient implantable medical devices.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that Mo and W are promising candidates for biodegradable electronic components, potentially enabling fully transient implantable systems for real-time physiological monitoring. However, challenges remain in integrating these materials into fully bioresorbable medical devices.
population_specificity: Not specified (theoretical/biomedical application focus)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the metabolic roles of molybdenum hydroxylase enzymes (AOX and XOR) in drug and chemical metabolism, including their substrate specificity and bioactivation potential.
results_summary: The study found that molybdenum hydroxylases (AOX and XOR) catalyze oxidation and reduction reactions but contribute minimally to the metabolism of currently marketed drugs, with AOX being more relevant in drug discovery than XOR due to broader substrate specificity.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of enzyme activity)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the accumulation of metal ions, including molybdenum, and their genotoxic and cytotoxic effects in oral mucosa cells from exposure to intraoral fixed appliances.
results_summary: The study found accumulations of molybdenum among other metals in oral mucosa cells, but specific effects of molybdenum were not detailed. Early-stage metal ion release and acute cell/DNA damage were observed, though long-term effects remain unclear.
population_specificity: Patients with intraoral fixed appliances (orthodontic treatment).
study_duration: Not specified (abstract mentions early and long-term exposure but no exact durations).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of 2D molybdenum sulfide (MoS) as a new generation antibacterial agent to address bacterial resistance.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that 2D molybdenum sulfide shows promise as an antibacterial agent, but specific efficacy results are not detailed. The study highlights the urgency of developing new antibacterial treatments due to rising bacterial resistance.
population_specificity: Not specified (likely in vitro or preclinical study based on context).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review Inborn Errors of Metabolism (IEMs) causing neonatal seizures and epilepsy, focusing on those not detected by Expanded Newborn Screening, including Molybdenum-Cofactor Deficiency.
results_summary: The study highlights that IEMs like Molybdenum-Cofactor Deficiency can cause neonatal seizures resistant to common antiseizure drugs, emphasizing the need for early diagnosis and targeted treatment to improve neurological outcomes.
population_specificity: Neonates (first 28 days of life) with seizures, particularly those resistant to standard antiseizure drugs.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the influence of various materials, including cobalt-chrome-molybdenum alloy, on the proliferation of human gingival fibroblasts in dental implant abutments.
results_summary: The study found that cobalt-chrome-molybdenum alloy was among the materials analyzed, but no specific results regarding its efficacy or safety were highlighted compared to other materials like zirconia or titanium.
population_specificity: Human gingival fibroblasts in vitro.
study_duration: Cell proliferation was measured at 3-4 or 6-7 days.

study_goal: The researchers were attempting to determine the proportion of patients reporting squeaking with ceramic-on-ceramic THA bearings containing molybdenum and its association with implant factors, revision rates, and functional outcomes.
results_summary: The study found that 53% of patients reported squeaking, which was more common with titanium-molybdenum-zirconium-iron stems. Squeaking did not affect revision rates or functional outcomes.
population_specificity: Patients who underwent ceramic-on-ceramic THA (mean age 44 ± 11 years, 68% male).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential therapeutic mechanisms of dietary molybdenum in treating iron-deficiency anemia and arthritis, and hypothesize its uses for other diseases.
results_summary: The study suggests that dietary molybdenum may treat iron-deficiency anemia and could potentially alleviate joint pain in arthritis, possibly by enhancing molybdoenzyme activity, restoring malfunctioning enzymes, or blocking nuclear receptors. However, the exact mechanism remains unclear.
population_specificity: Humans on an oral diet, not exposed to unsafe levels of molybdenum antagonists.

study_goal: The researchers were exploring the applications of molybdenum disulfide (MoS₂) as a two-dimensional nanomaterial in various fields.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings about Molybdenum's effects, only mentioning its potential applications as a nanomaterial.
population_specificity: Not specified

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the mechanisms of geogenic contaminant mobilization, including molybdenum, during managed aquifer recharge (MAR) operations and their implications for groundwater quality.
results_summary: The study identified molybdenum as one of several geogenic contaminants of concern in MAR sites, where shifting redox conditions and other geochemical processes can mobilize it from sediments into groundwater, posing risks to human and ecosystem health.
population_specificity: Not specified (focus on MAR sites globally)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize recent advancements in the design, fabrication, and application of MoS2-based nanocomposites for cancer therapy and diagnosis.
results_summary: The review highlights MoS2 nanocomposites' potential in various therapeutic strategies (photothermal, photodynamic, immunotherapy, gene therapy, chemotherapy) and diagnostic techniques (MRI, CT, photoacoustic imaging, fluorescence imaging) for cancer treatment. Case studies demonstrate their efficacy in combined therapeutic approaches.
population_specificity: Not specified (review article, not a clinical study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential of 2D materials, including molybdenum disulfide (MoS2), for cancer theranostics, focusing on their diagnostic and therapeutic applications.
results_summary: The study highlighted MoS2 as one of the emerging 2D materials with strong potential for cancer theranostics, particularly in combination with imaging and therapeutic approaches like drug delivery and photothermal therapy. However, it also noted unresolved issues hindering clinical translation.
population_specificity: Not specified (literature review of preclinical and clinical studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether titanium-nitride (TiN) coating on cobalt-chromium-molybdenum (CoCrMo) implants improves clinical outcomes, including pain reduction and functional scores, compared to uncoated implants over a 10-year follow-up.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in pain, functional outcomes, or revision rates between TiN-coated and uncoated CoCrMo TKAs after 10 years, suggesting comparable long-term results. The in vitro benefits of TiN coating did not translate into better clinical outcomes.
population_specificity: 101 patients receiving cementless mobile-bearing CoCrMo total knee arthroplasty (TKA).
effective_dosage: Not applicable (implant coating, not oral dosage).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to characterize the clinical presentation, diagnostic clues, and potential interventions for late-onset isolated sulfite oxidase deficiency (ISOD), a condition linked to SUOX gene mutations.
results_summary: The study found that trivial trauma can trigger metabolic crises in late-onset ISOD, identified globus pallidi changes with diffusion restriction on MRI as key diagnostic markers, and suggested early dietary intervention may prevent long-term neurodisability.
population_specificity: Children with late-onset isolated sulfite oxidase deficiency (12 cases analyzed, including two new cases).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of molybdenum-containing proteins, particularly sulfite oxidase (SUOX), in Alzheimer's disease (AD) and propose a novel treatment addressing dysregulations linked to low trans-sulfuration pathway activity and L-cysteine levels.
results_summary: The study suggests that dysregulation of molybdenum-containing proteins like SUOX may contribute to AD pathology by impairing sulfite detoxification and glutaminergic neurotransmission, potentially exacerbating oxidative stress and metabolic dysfunction.
population_specificity: Alzheimer's disease patients (theoretical, as the study is a proposal rather than an empirical trial).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of molybdenum cofactor (MoCo) synthesis in the transsulfuration pathway and its implications for treatment-resistant schizophrenia (TRS).
results_summary: The study suggests that low MoCo synthesis due to L-cysteine shortages may impair sulfite oxidase (SUOX) activity, leading to sulfite toxicity and contributing to oxidative stress and epigenetic changes in TRS.
population_specificity: Individuals with treatment-resistant schizophrenia (TRS).

study_goal: The researchers reviewed the progress in FET-based biosensors using nanomaterials, including molybdenum disulfide, for biosensing applications.
results_summary: The abstract highlights the use of molybdenum disulfide in FET biosensors for detecting clinically relevant biomarkers but does not report specific findings on its effects.
population_specificity: Not specified (review paper, not a clinical study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the biological effects and biocompatibility of different nanoforms of elemental molybdenum and its compounds, focusing on their potential therapeutic applications and safety.
results_summary: The study found mixed results regarding the toxicity of molybdenum nanomaterials, with some studies classifying them as very toxic, mildly toxic, or non-toxic, and proposed mechanisms including oxidative stress, membrane disruption, or DNA damage. However, the potential medical applications of molybdenum disulfide (MoS) were highlighted as promising.
population_specificity: Not specified (various experimental models were used in the reviewed publications).
effective_dosage: Not specified (different concentrations were used across studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the levels of essential elements, including molybdenum, in packed red blood cells (PRBCs) between smoker and non-smoker donors.
results_summary: The study found that molybdenum levels were not significantly different between PRBCs from smoker and non-smoker donors, unlike other essential elements which were lower in smokers.
population_specificity: Smoker (n=36) and non-smoker (n=36) blood donors at Hospital de Clínicas de Porto Alegre, Brazil.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review prosthesis designs in animal models for periprosthetic joint infections (PJI) after total knee arthroplasty (TKA), focusing on materials like cobalt-chromium-molybdenum alloy.
results_summary: The study identified criteria for a clinically representative PJI animal model, recommending prostheses made of titanium-6Al-4V or cobalt-chromium-molybdenum alloy, with smooth surfaces for biofilm formation, weight-bearing capability, and stability.
population_specificity: Animal models of periprosthetic joint infections after total knee arthroplasty.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review advances in bioresorbable materials, including molybdenum, for implantable medical devices.
results_summary: The abstract mentions molybdenum as a bioresorbable material used in implantable devices but does not provide specific findings on its effects.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of materials for implantable devices).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to provide an overview of renal radionuclide PET radiotracers, with a focus on novel developments.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings regarding Molybdenum's effects.
population_specificity: Not specified in the abstract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to characterize the clinical and molecular features of molybdenum cofactor deficiency caused by MOCS2 mutations, including identifying novel neuroradiological findings.
results_summary: The study found that MOCS2 mutations lead to severe neurological symptoms, including neonatal seizures, delayed motor milestones, and facial dysmorphism. Novel findings included agenesis of the corpus callosum and an interhemispheric cyst in one patient.
population_specificity: 35 patients with MOCS2 gene mutations, primarily children with neurological symptoms.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the role of cysteine metabolism in the brain under normal and pathological conditions, including molybdenum cofactor deficiency (MoCD).
results_summary: The abstract highlights the importance of cysteine metabolism in brain function and its dysregulation in neurodegenerative disorders like MoCD, suggesting that restoring cysteine balance may have therapeutic benefits.
population_specificity: General discussion of brain metabolism, with specific mention of neurodegenerative conditions like Huntington's disease and MoCD.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the long-term effects of Molybdenum (as part of Factor C, combined with vitamin C) on mortality and specific cancer outcomes in a nutritionally deprived population.
results_summary: Factor C (vitamin C/molybdenum) showed a protective effect against stroke in participants younger than 55 but increased esophageal cancer risk in those older than 55. No significant effect on total mortality was observed.
population_specificity: 29,584 residents of Linxian, China, aged 40-69 years, with nutritional deficiencies.
effective_dosage: Not specified (combined with vitamin C in Factor C).
study_duration: 5.25 years of intervention, followed by up to 25 years of observation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare metal ion concentrations (including molybdenum) in patients receiving coated versus uncoated TKA implants, assessing safety and clinical outcomes.
results_summary: Molybdenum concentrations in blood did not change significantly after surgery in either group, indicating no adverse effect from the implants. The study found no clinical differences in patient-reported outcomes between coated and uncoated implants.
population_specificity: 122 patients (59 per group after exclusions) undergoing total knee arthroplasty (TKA).
study_duration: Follow-up assessments up to 3 years post-surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the structural and functional roles of molybdenum-containing enzymes (xanthine oxidoreductase and aldehyde oxidase) in xenobiotic metabolism and disease progression, and to analyze inhibitor specificity for these enzymes.
results_summary: The study highlighted the roles of xanthine oxidoreductase and aldehyde oxidase in metabolizing xenobiotics and their association with diseases like gout, diabetes, and cancer. It also provided structural insights for designing inhibitors targeting these enzymes.
population_specificity: Not specified (review article)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the diverse biological effects and potential applications of cyclic phosphates, including their role in Molybdenum-containing enzymes.
results_summary: The abstract mentions that some cyclic phosphates are an essential component of Molybdenum-containing enzymes, but no specific effects or outcomes related to Molybdenum are detailed.
population_specificity: Not specified (review article)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review clinical, neuroimaging, biochemical, and genetic findings in patients with isolated sulfite oxidase deficiency (ISOD) to distinguish it from molybdenum cofactor deficiency (MoCD) type A.
results_summary: The study found that ISOD presents with severe neurological abnormalities, and biochemical tests (e.g., homocysteine, uric acid) can help differentiate it from MoCD. Brain imaging consistently revealed abnormalities in all examined patients.
population_specificity: 47 patients (45 from literature) with ISOD, mostly presenting symptoms within the first 72 hours of life.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to highlight treatable metabolic epilepsies, including molybdenum cofactor deficiency, and the impact of targeted interventions on disease outcomes.
results_summary: The abstract mentions molybdenum cofactor deficiency as one of the treatable metabolic epilepsies but does not provide specific results regarding its effects. Early identification and targeted treatment can significantly improve outcomes for these disorders.
population_specificity: Pediatric patients with metabolic epilepsies, including those with molybdenum cofactor deficiency.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the corrosion behavior of molybdenum-containing biocompatible metals (e.g., cobalt-chromium-molybdenum alloys) in implants and explore surface modification techniques to improve corrosion resistance and biocompatibility.
results_summary: The study found that molybdenum-containing alloys, like cobalt-chromium-molybdenum, are used in implants but face corrosion issues in fluidic body environments. Surface modification techniques (e.g., coatings, passivation layers, laser treatment) were identified as effective solutions to enhance corrosion resistance and biocompatibility.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on biomaterial implants in human body environments).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential therapeutic applications of molybdenum-based metallodrugs in treating various diseases and inspire further research in the field.
results_summary: The study highlights historical success of Mo-based metallodrugs in treating conditions like anemia and Wilson's disease, and suggests potential mechanisms of action, but notes a lack of comprehensive reviews and slow development of new Mo-based pharmaceuticals.
population_specificity: Not specified (review article)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and test a compact flow analysis system for monitoring phosphate removal during hemodialysis using a molybdenum blue method.
results_summary: The monitor demonstrated comparable results to the reference off-line method for phosphate determination in spent dialysate, and the study suggested potential for two-side (dialysate and blood) monitoring in hemodialysis treatments.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing clinical hemodialysis treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to characterize thermoluminescence detectors (TLDs) for measuring entrance surface air kerma (ESAK) and estimating mean glandular dose (MGD) in digital mammography, using low-energy x-ray beams with molybdenum filtration.
results_summary: The study found that lithium fluoride-based TLDs (LiF:Mg,Ti and LiF:Mg,Cu,P) performed better in terms of linearity, reproducibility, energy dependence, and fading compared to lithium borate-based TLDs. The combined standard uncertainty for ESAK measurement was below ±10% for all tested materials except TLD-800 (Li2B4O7:Mn), which was excluded due to poor sensitivity.
population_specificity: Not specified (laboratory and clinical mammography settings).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the biosynthesis of the molybdenum cofactor (Moco), the functions of Moco-dependent enzymes, and the consequences of Moco deficiency in humans.
results_summary: The study highlights that Moco deficiency leads to severe metabolic disorders, often fatal in early childhood, primarily due to impaired sulfite oxidase activity. It also notes that Moco-dependent enzymes perform novel reactions, such as nitrite reduction to nitric oxide.
population_specificity: Humans, particularly those with inborn errors of metabolism related to Moco deficiency.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review and classify the modes of action of molybdenum and other mineral elements in diabetes mellitus therapy.
results_summary: The study found that molybdenum facilitates glucose catabolism, enhances insulin activity, and stimulates lipogenesis, with mechanisms similar to conventional anti-diabetic drugs. However, the safe doses and synergistic effects of molybdenum combinations remain unclear.
population_specificity: Not specified (general diabetic population inferred from literature review).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare cobalt and chromium ion levels in patients with metal versus ceramic femoral heads in total hip arthroplasty (THA) using a titanium alloy stem containing molybdenum.
results_summary: The study found higher cobalt and chromium levels in patients with metal heads compared to ceramic heads, with 36-mm metal heads showing larger cobalt levels than 32-mm heads. Some patients with metal heads exhibited mild hip symptoms and early adverse local tissue reactions.
population_specificity: 60 patients with noncemented THA using a titanium alloy femoral stem (containing molybdenum) and a V40 trunnion.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review Molybdenum cofactor deficiency (MoCD) and evaluate the therapeutic potential of cyclic PMP for MoCD type A.
results_summary: The study found that early treatment with cyclic PMP can transform MoCD type A from a neonatal lethal condition to one with near-normal neurological outcomes. The accumulation of sulfite and related compounds contributes to severe neurological impairment, which cyclic PMP appears to mitigate.
population_specificity: Neonates with MoCD type A caused by pathogenic variants in MOCD1.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of cyclic pyranopterin monophosphate (cPMP) substitution therapy in neonates with Molybdenum cofactor deficiency (MoCD) types A and B.
results_summary: cPMP treatment normalized disease biomarkers in type A patients within 2 days, reduced or eliminated seizures, and improved neurodevelopmental outcomes when started early. No biochemical or clinical response was observed in type B patients, and no drug-related serious adverse events were reported.
population_specificity: Neonates diagnosed with MoCD (11 type A and 5 type B).
study_duration: Up to 5 years in some patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the effectiveness of titanium-molybdenum alloy (TMA) transpalatal arches (TPAs) for correcting transverse discrepancies in orthodontic treatment.
results_summary: Symmetric TPA treatments achieved a mean correction of 4.5 mm and 10.1° buccal crown tipping, closely matching simulated results. Asymmetric TPAs successfully corrected unilateral crossbite in all cases with minimal vertical side effects.
population_specificity: Ten patients (six with symmetric and four with asymmetric transverse discrepancies).
effective_dosage: TPAs adjusted to an expansive force of 4 N.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether serum molybdenum concentrations in ceramic-on-metal total hip arthroplasty (CoM-THA) patients differed from pre-operative levels and compared them to metal-on-metal (MoM-THA) patients.
results_summary: Molybdenum concentrations in CoM-THA patients were not significantly different from pre-operative levels (p = 0.45) and were not compared directly to MoM-THA patients. No adverse effects related to molybdenum were reported.
population_specificity: 20 CoM-THA patients and 29 MoM-THA patients at an average 3-year follow-up.

study_goal: The researchers examined the use of chromium-molybdenum alloy prostheses in elbow replacement arthroplasty for treating joint diseases and trauma.
results_summary: The study found that linked semiconstrained chromium-molybdenum alloy prostheses are commonly used in elbow replacements, with 10-year survival rates of ~90%, though complications like infection and loosening can occur.
population_specificity: Patients with late-stage rheumatoid arthritis, joint diseases, or elbow trauma requiring arthroplasty.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review and update guidelines for micronutrient supplementation, including Molybdenum, in adult patients receiving parenteral nutrition, based on recent literature and regional practice considerations.
results_summary: The study recommended reduced doses of Molybdenum compared to the 1999 guidelines, acknowledging challenges in aligning guidelines with current multi-trace element formulations and the need for further research on clinical impacts.
population_specificity: Adult patients receiving parenteral nutrition in Australia and New Zealand.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review studies on XOR inhibitors to understand the chemical nature and reaction mechanism of the Moco active site in XOR and its implications for treating hyperuricemia, gout, and other diseases.
results_summary: The abstract highlights XOR's role in purine catabolism and its potential as a drug target for various diseases, focusing on XOR inhibitors and their implications for understanding Moco's active site. It suggests further studies are needed to clarify remaining issues.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing studies)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether TiN coating of CoCrMo total knee prostheses affects postoperative clinical outcomes in total knee arthroplasty.
results_summary: The study found no difference in pain, function, revision rate, or other clinical outcomes between TiN-coated and uncoated CoCrMo knee prostheses, concluding that TiN coating provides no clinical benefit.
population_specificity: 101 patients undergoing uncemented mobile-bearing total knee arthroplasty.
study_duration: Follow-up assessments at 6 weeks, 6 months, 1 year, and 5 years postoperative.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review systemic toxicity cases attributed to metal release from hip implants, focusing on cobalt and chromium, not Molybdenum.
results_summary: The study found systemic toxicity (neuro-ocular, cardiac, and thyroid effects) in patients with cobalt-containing hip implants, particularly after revision from ceramic to metal components. No findings related to Molybdenum were reported.
population_specificity: Patients with hip replacements experiencing systemic toxicity from metal implants.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify the prevalence of purine and pyrimidine disorders, including molybdenum cofactor deficiency, in patients with suspected inborn errors of metabolism.
results_summary: The study identified six patients with molybdenum cofactor deficiency out of 1600 tested, highlighting its rarity but importance in metabolic screening. No specific effects or outcomes related to molybdenum supplementation or treatment were discussed.
population_specificity: Patients with suspected inborn errors of metabolism (1600 tested, 35 identified with various disorders).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the biochemistry of molybdenum, focusing on the functions and deficiencies of two Mo-enzymes (xanthine dehydrogenase and sulfite oxidase) and the molecular basis of Moco deficiency.
results_summary: Molybdenum is essential for mammalian enzymes, catalyzing oxygen transfer reactions. Deficiencies in Moco biosynthesis lead to loss of enzyme activity and early childhood death, with potential links to neuropsychiatric disorders.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of mammalian systems, with implications for humans).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the finishing effectiveness of stainless steel archwires versus titanium molybdenum alloy (TMA) archwires in orthodontic treatment using self-ligating brackets.
results_summary: The study found no clinically significant differences between SS and TMA archwires in finishing effectiveness, though some minor statistical differences were observed (e.g., higher decrease in irregularity index with SS archwires). The differences were deemed clinically negligible.
population_specificity: 32 orthodontic patients divided into two groups (21 with SS archwires, 12 with TMA archwires).
study_duration: Duration of treatment not explicitly stated (T1 to T2 timeframe unspecified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically review and assess metal ion concentrations, including molybdenum, in body fluids after metal-on-metal total hip arthroplasty.
results_summary: The study found persistently elevated metal ion concentrations, including molybdenum, in various body fluids after implantation of metal-on-metal bearings, with the highest levels observed in stemmed large-head implants and hip resurfacing arthroplasty.
population_specificity: Patients with metal-on-metal total hip arthroplasty or hip resurfacing arthroplasty.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare MRI artefacts produced by different hip prosthetic materials, including cobalt-chrome-molybdenum, to assess their impact on imaging quality.
results_summary: Cobalt-chrome-molybdenum produced smaller artefacts compared to cobalt-chrome but larger than ceramic, with artefact ratios increasing at higher magnetic field strengths (1.51 at 1 T and 1.67 at 1.5 T for SE sequences; 2.13 at 1 T and 2.48 at 1.5 T for GRE sequences).
population_specificity: In vitro evaluation using hip prostheses.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the safety of a novel coating for TKA implants, including potential hypersensitivity reactions and plasma ion concentrations related to molybdenum and other metals.
results_summary: The study found no increase in plasma molybdenum ion concentrations and no significant hypersensitivity reactions related to molybdenum at the one-year follow-up. Both coated and uncoated implant groups showed similar safety profiles regarding metal ion release.
population_specificity: 120 patients undergoing primary total knee arthroplasty with no history of hypersensitivity or other metal implants.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the role of metals, including molybdenum, in biological functions and their use in medicine, focusing on mechanisms of action for therapeutic and diagnostic applications.
results_summary: The abstract mentions that molybdenum is essential for normal biological functions in humans but does not provide specific findings about its effects. It highlights the broader use of metals in medicine, including molybdenum, for targeting proteins or DNA in disease treatment.
population_specificity: Humans (general, no specific subgroup mentioned)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the use of (18)F-fluoride PET/CT as an alternative to 99mTc-based bone tracers, particularly during molybdenum shortages, and its application in non-oncologic musculoskeletal disorders.
results_summary: The study found that (18)F-fluoride PET/CT is a viable alternative to 99mTc-based tracers, offering high image quality and short examination times. It showed promise in diagnosing various musculoskeletal disorders, including bisphosphonate-induced osteonecrosis, postsurgical changes, and conditions like ankylosing spondylitis and Paget disease.
population_specificity: Patients with non-oncologic musculoskeletal disorders, including those with bisphosphonate-induced osteonecrosis, postsurgical changes, ankylosing spondylitis, Paget disease, and suspected child abuse or back pain in young patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to characterize the clinical and genomic implications of GPHN mutations, including their association with neurodevelopmental disorders and molybdenum cofactor deficiency.
results_summary: The study identified rare microdeletions in the GPHN gene in individuals with neurodevelopmental conditions, linking these mutations to synaptic dysfunction and reinforcing the role of synaptic gene products in neurodevelopmental disorders. The findings also connect GPHN mutations to molybdenum cofactor deficiency.
population_specificity: Six unrelated subjects with neurodevelopmental diagnoses (ASD, schizophrenia, or seizures).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical safety and performance of a poly(2-methacryloyloxyethyl phosphorylcholine)-grafted cross-linked polyethylene liner paired with a cobalt-chromium-molybdenum alloy ball in total hip replacement.
results_summary: The study found no adverse events linked to the implanted liners, significant improvement in hip joint function scores (from 43.2 to 91.7), and no implant migration or osteolysis after one year.
population_specificity: 80 patients undergoing cementless total hip replacement across five hospitals.
effective_dosage: Not specified (implied standard surgical use of a 26-mm-diameter cobalt-chromium-molybdenum alloy ball).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review and evaluate various separation technologies for producing clinical-grade (99m)Tc from (99)Mo, particularly focusing on alternative routes due to shortages of fission-produced (99)Mo.
results_summary: The study found that traditional separation methods like column chromatography, solvent extraction, and sublimation can be adapted for clinical-grade (99m)Tc production, while emerging technologies like solid-phase extraction and electrochemical separation show promise for future applications.
population_specificity: Not applicable (review of separation technologies, not human or animal subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review mutation and chemical modification studies of mammalian XOR and human XOR mutations to understand XOR's reaction mechanism and assess mutated XORs as models for estimating side effects of XOR inhibitors.
results_summary: The abstract discusses XOR's role in xanthinuria and molybdenum cofactor deficiency but does not present specific study results on Molybdenum's effects. It highlights XOR's involvement in diseases and its inhibition as a therapeutic target.
population_specificity: Not specified (focus on enzyme mechanisms and genetic defects)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review clinical cases of Molybdenum cofactor deficiency in Turkish patients to better understand its genetic and clinical characteristics.
results_summary: The study reviewed 12 patients with Molybdenum cofactor deficiency, highlighting common symptoms like neonatal seizures and encephalopathy, and noted frequent misdiagnosis as hypoxic ischemic encephalopathy. Genetic mutations in MOCS1 and MOCS2 were identified as primary causes, but therapeutic strategies remain unimproved.
population_specificity: 12 patients with Molybdenum cofactor deficiency from Turkey.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the chemical nature and reaction mechanisms of the molybdenum cofactor in xanthine oxidoreductase (XOR), focusing on its medical importance, including nitric oxide synthesis.
results_summary: The study found that XOR catalyzes reactions involving the molybdenum cofactor, such as the conversion of hypoxanthine to xanthine and xanthine to urate, and explored potential medical applications, including nitric oxide synthesis. However, the physiological significance of some reactions, like NO formation from nitrite, remains unclear due to slow catalytic rates under anaerobic conditions.
population_specificity: Not specified (focus on enzymatic mechanisms, not human subjects)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the role of molybdenum-containing proteins in the conversion of nitrite to nitric oxide and its potential therapeutic implications for pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH).
results_summary: The study found that molybdenum-containing proteins, such as xanthine oxidase, play a critical role in converting nitrite to nitric oxide, which may offer therapeutic benefits for PAH. Early clinical trials and animal models suggest nitrite (and thus indirectly molybdenum-dependent pathways) could be a promising therapy for PAH and other cardiovascular diseases.
population_specificity: Animal models and early clinical trials (specific human population not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of molybdenum (via thiomolybdate) in copper metabolism, its potential therapeutic applications (e.g., Wilson's disease, tumors, inflammatory diseases), and the risks of inducing copper deficiency in ruminants and humans.
results_summary: The study found that molybdenum-rich pastures promote thiomolybdate synthesis, leading to copper deficiency (hypocuprosis) in ruminants. While thiomolybdate shows exploratory therapeutic potential in humans, there is a risk of TM-induced copper deficiency, highlighting the need for biomarkers to monitor its impact.
population_specificity: Ruminants (e.g., lambs) and humans (with focus on genetic/metabolic conditions like Wilson's disease).
interactions: Copper metabolism (formation of Cu-TM complexes), potential interaction with immunity to infection.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare patient discomfort during archwire engagement and disengagement between self-ligating and conventional brackets, including the use of titanium molybdenum archwires.
results_summary: The study found that disengagement was significantly more painful with SmartClip self-ligating brackets, particularly for rigid rectangular archwires like titanium molybdenum. Retrospective ratings favored conventional brackets over self-ligating ones.
population_specificity: 18 orthodontic patients (15 female, 3 male; age 22.2 ± 6.4 years) undergoing fixed appliance treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the physiologic role, metabolic demands, requirements, deficiency syndromes, and toxicity symptoms associated with molybdenum supplementation in parenteral nutrition for surgical neonates.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings on molybdenum's effects, only mentioning it among trace elements reviewed. No distinct conclusions or data on molybdenum are highlighted.
population_specificity: Surgical neonates in intensive care receiving parenteral nutrition.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of molybdenum enzymes in the reduction of nitrite to nitric oxide (NO) under hypoxic conditions in mammals, particularly in humans.
results_summary: The study found that molybdenum enzymes, along with heme-containing proteins, contribute to the reduction of nitrite to NO in tissues and blood under hypoxic conditions, playing a role in vascular function and ischemic injury.
population_specificity: Mammals, with a focus on humans.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare protein expression differences, including molybdenum ABC transporter ModD, between H. pylori strains isolated from gastric cancer and gastritis patients.
results_summary: The study identified molybdenum ABC transporter ModD as one of nine differentially expressed proteins between H. pylori strains, suggesting potential variability in molybdenum-related pathways during infection. No direct effects or outcomes related to molybdenum supplementation or toxicity were reported.
population_specificity: H. pylori strains isolated from gastric cancer and gastritis/duodenal ulcer patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review complications from metallic wear debris, including cobalt-chromium-molybdenum (CoCrMo) alloy, in spinal arthroplasty devices and compare them to issues seen in hip arthroplasty.
results_summary: The study identified cases of abnormal inflammatory reactions, pseudotumors, and metal hypersensitivity linked to CoCrMo wear debris in spinal arthroplasty, with clinical features similar to those in hip arthroplasty. Histological findings showed necrotic debris, chronic inflammation, and varying lymphocyte/macrophage responses depending on wear rates.
population_specificity: Patients with metal-on-metal spinal arthroplasty devices.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of molybdenum and other metals in drug-eluting stents, particularly their contribution to hypersensitivity inflammation and stent thrombosis.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that molybdenum, as part of the metal strut in drug-eluting stents, may contribute to an antigenic complex that induces chronic inflammatory responses, potentially leading to stent thrombosis. However, specific effects of molybdenum alone are not isolated or detailed.
population_specificity: Patients with coronary artery disease receiving drug-eluting stents.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of molybdenum, among other antioxidants, in preventing cancer based on large clinical trials.
results_summary: The study found no convincing evidence to support the use of molybdenum or other traditional antioxidant-related vitamins or minerals for cancer prevention. The lack of success was attributed to factors like insufficient biological rationale, limited agents tested, and suboptimal study designs.
population_specificity: Large trials with at least 7000 participants (general population for cancer prevention).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether different bearing materials, including Cobalt-Chrome-Molybdenum, impact femoral bone remodeling after hybrid total hip arthroplasty.
results_summary: The study found that bone mineral density (BMD) decreased significantly in all Gruen zones, with the largest declines in the Alumina group (D). BMD changes correlated with patient height, weight, age, and stem size, suggesting that bearing material composition may influence bone remodeling.
population_specificity: 205 patients who underwent hybrid total hip arthroplasty, with follow-up over four years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of light and heavy rotational orthodontic forces on root resorption in human premolars, using molybdenum alloys for light force application.
results_summary: Heavy rotational forces caused significantly more root resorption than light forces, with resorption craters primarily found at specific root surfaces. The study confirmed that compression areas (buccal-distal and lingual-mesial surfaces) exhibited higher resorption.
population_specificity: Fifteen patients requiring bilateral extraction of maxillary first premolars as part of orthodontic treatment.
effective_dosage: 0.016-inch beta-titanium molybdenum alloy for light force (25 g).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the in vivo release of metal ions, including molybdenum, from orthodontic alloys and assess their genotoxicity.
results_summary: The study detected molybdenum concentrations in oral mucosa cells but did not specifically report its genotoxic effects or safety profile compared to other metals.
population_specificity: 15 patients aged 12-16 years undergoing orthodontic treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore how molybdenum, as part of anticancer metal complexes, interacts with cellular redox homeostasis and its potential role in cancer treatment.
results_summary: The study highlights that molybdenum, like other anticancer metal complexes, can disturb cellular redox homeostasis, suggesting its potential in targeting cancer cells by disrupting their redox balance. However, specific efficacy data on molybdenum alone were not detailed.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on anticancer mechanisms in cellular systems)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of titanium-molybdenum alloy (TMA) and nickel-titanium (NiTi) T-loops in maxillary canine retraction, focusing on space closure rate and tooth angulation.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in the rate of space closure or canine tipping between TMA and NiTi T-loops, though NiTi loops exhibited superior shape retention after cyclical activation.
population_specificity: 12 patients (6 males, 6 females) aged 13-20 years with upper premolar extractions.
effective_dosage: T-loops were activated 3 mm per visit, delivering ~150 g of force.

study_goal: The researchers reviewed the properties, porous coating, osseointegration, outcomes, and failure of Co-Cr alloy orthopedic implants, which include molybdenum as a trace element.
results_summary: The abstract highlights the importance of Co-Cr alloys (containing molybdenum) in orthopedic implants due to their high strength, wear resistance, and osseointegration potential, but does not specifically report on molybdenum's isolated effects.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of Co-Cr alloy implants).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether orthodontic appliances or tooth movement involving a titanium-molybdenum alloy archwire could induce detectable changes in gingival crevicular fluid (GCF) volume, assessing its potential as a biomarker for tissue remodeling.
results_summary: The study found a modest but significant increase in GCF volume over time in both test and control teeth, suggesting subclinical inflammation from the orthodontic appliance rather than tooth movement. GCF volume was not deemed a reliable biomarker for tissue remodeling during orthodontic treatment.
population_specificity: 16 healthy orthodontic patients (7 females, 9 males; mean age 17.7 years, range 13-27) requiring upper premolar extractions.
effective_dosage: 0.017 × 0.025 inch titanium-molybdenum alloy archwire (force application not quantified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to describe the role of the universal molybdenum cofactor (MoCo) in human molybdoenzymes and the consequences of genetic mutations affecting its biosynthesis.
results_summary: The study found that mutations in genes encoding MoCo biosynthetic enzymes lead to severe neurological damage and early childhood death, with clinical similarities to isolated sulfite oxidase deficiency. An effective substitution therapy has been identified for type A deficiency.
population_specificity: Humans with genetic mutations in MOCS1, MOCS2, or GPHN genes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of PET imaging as an alternative to molybdenum-99/technetium-99m in assessing myocardial blood flow and metabolism in ischemic heart disease.
results_summary: The study highlights PET imaging as a viable alternative for perfusion imaging amid molybdenum-99 shortages, emphasizing its established role in evaluating myocardial blood flow and metabolism in ischemic heart disease. It also notes potential future applications in plaque and molecular imaging.
population_specificity: Patients with ischemic heart disease, particularly those with left ventricular dysfunction.

study_goal: The researchers sought to determine which clinical and radiographic parameters are associated with elevated levels of cobalt, chromium, and molybdenum in patients after unilateral metal-on-metal surface arthroplasty.
results_summary: The study found that smaller femoral head diameter and larger acetabular inclination were associated with higher cobalt and chromium levels, but molybdenum levels were not specifically discussed in the results.
population_specificity: 91 patients with a minimum follow-up of 24 months after metal-on-metal hip resurfacing.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the influence of two different cementing interfaces of femoral components (made of cobalt-chromium-molybdenum alloy) on wear behavior in knee joint prostheses.
results_summary: The study found significant differences in wear behavior between the two cementing interfaces, with mean weight loss being a key metric. Scanning electron microscopy revealed macro- and micro-pores on both configurations, but the study did not focus on Molybdenum's direct effects.
population_specificity: Synthetic composite femurs and custom metallic blocks used in knee joint wear simulations.
effective_dosage: Not specified (Molybdenum is part of the alloy, not a standalone supplement).
study_duration: 3 million cycles at 1.1 Hz (simulated wear testing).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate how surface stoichiometric ratios of metallic micro-particulates, including molybdenum in F75 cobalt-chromium-molybdenum alloy, contribute to bioreactive or cytotoxic cellular responses leading to aseptic osteolysis.
results_summary: The study found that micro-particulates with high surface cobalt content caused severe cellular toxicity, but did not specifically highlight molybdenum's role in toxicity or bioreactivity. Surface analysis techniques like XPS were emphasized for characterizing metallic materials before interpreting cellular responses.
population_specificity: Volunteer donors (cell culture viability data from four individuals).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore associations between molybdenum exposure and male reproductive hormone levels, particularly testosterone (T).
results_summary: Molybdenum was associated with reduced testosterone levels, with a significant inverse trend persisting even when accounting for other metals. High molybdenum combined with low zinc was linked to a 37% reduction in T.
population_specificity: Men recruited through infertility clinics in Michigan (n=219).
interactions: Interaction noted with zinc, where high molybdenum and low zinc led to reduced T.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare serum molybdenum (Mo) levels between patients with metal-on-metal Birmingham hip resurfacing (MOM-BHR) and metal-on-metal total hip arthroplasty (MOM-THA) at 2 and 5 years, and assess confounding factors like gender.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in Mo levels between MOM-BHR and MOM-THA patients at 5 years. Ion levels were 7-10 times higher in patients than in healthy controls but remained within literature-reported ranges.
population_specificity: Patients with MOM-BHR (n=20 at 5 years, n=15 at 2 years) or MOM-THA (n=35 at 5 years, n=25 at 2 years), and 48 healthy blood donors as controls.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize current literature on molybdenum intake recommendations, its physiological role, and its impact on gestational outcomes.
results_summary: The study highlights molybdenum's essential role in human health, its potential benefits as an anti-diabetic and antioxidant inducer, but notes conflicting data on chronic disease benefits. Overexposure and deficiency can lead to adverse outcomes, but physiological doses remain understudied, especially during pregnancy.
population_specificity: General human population, with specific focus on pregnancy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of a monounsaturated fatty acids (MUFAs)-rich diet on resting energy expenditure, substrate oxidation, and weight loss in women with obesity.
results_summary: The MUFAs-rich diet (G2) led to significant reductions in body weight, BMI, waist circumference, and body fat compared to the usual diet group (G3). No significant adverse effects were reported.
population_specificity: Women with obesity (n=32).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of the ADIPOQ gene variant (rs3774261) on metabolic and adiposity parameters after a hypocaloric Mediterranean diet high in monounsaturated fatty acids.
results_summary: The study found that patients with the AA genotype showed significant improvements in LDL cholesterol, total cholesterol, triglycerides, CRP, and adiponectin levels after the dietary intervention, while G allele carriers did not exhibit these improvements.
population_specificity: 133 patients with obesity

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of monounsaturated fatty acids (MUFA) on tissue-specific insulin sensitivity and energy metabolism.
results_summary: The study found that a single MUFA-load induced insulin resistance, reducing hepatic and whole-body insulin sensitivity, but did not affect hepatic triglycerides or energy-rich phosphates. These results suggest that the amount of ingested fat, rather than its composition, primarily determines acute insulin resistance.
population_specificity: 16 glucose-tolerant volunteers
study_duration: Single administration (cross-over study with two occasions)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the effects of an enriched-monounsaturated fat hypocaloric diet on metabolic changes, particularly in relation to the rs670 APOA1 gene polymorphism in obese subjects.
results_summary: The study found that the monounsaturated fat diet (diet M) reduced body mass index, weight, fat mass, waist circumference, systolic blood pressure, and plasma leptin levels in all patients. In A-allele carriers, diet M also improved insulin resistance (HOMA-IR) and insulin levels, but no significant changes in lipid profile (LDL/HDL cholesterol) were observed compared to the polyunsaturated fat diet.
population_specificity: 360 Caucasian obese subjects

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the chronic effects of substituting monounsaturated fatty acids (MUFAs) for saturated fatty acids (SAFAs) on insulin secretion and insulin sensitivity in centrally obese subjects.
results_summary: The study found that exchanging MUFA for SAFA at 7% energy had no appreciable adverse impact on insulin secretion, with similar effects on most markers compared to SAFA, except for increased fasting glucose-dependent insulinotropic peptide concentrations after MUFA.
population_specificity: Abdominally overweight men and women.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the postprandial metabolic responses between high-saturated fat (HSM) and high-monounsaturated fat (HMM) meals in women of varying weight statuses.
results_summary: The study found that monounsaturated fat (HMM) led to lower postprandial increments in complement C3 compared to saturated fat (HSM). Additionally, plasma oleic acid levels remained elevated in normal-weight women but not in overweight women after HMM consumption.
population_specificity: 63 women (35 normal weight, 28 overweight), aged 26.9 ± 6.1 years.
effective_dosage: Test meals included 2 muffins (HMM: 34.5% monounsaturated fat).
study_duration: Acute intervention (postprandial measurements up to 5 hours).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of replacing saturated fats (SFA) with monounsaturated fats (MUFA) or refined carbohydrates on inflammatory, thrombogenic, and lipid markers in abdominally obese individuals.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in fasting inflammatory and thrombogenic markers between MUFA and SFA diets. However, postprandial D-dimer levels increased with MUFA consumption, and refined carbohydrates negatively impacted HDL subfractions compared to SFA.
population_specificity: 54 abdominally obese subjects
effective_dosage: MUFA-rich diet exchanged ~7E% of SFA with MUFA (isocaloric 2000 kcal diet)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the feasibility and effects of replacing saturated fats (SFAs) with monounsaturated fats (MUFAs) in dairy products on dietary compliance and plasma phospholipid fatty acid profiles.
results_summary: The study found that replacing SFAs with MUFAs in dairy products led to a significant reduction in SFA intake (17.2%TE vs. 19.1%TE) and an increase in MUFA intake (15.4%TE vs. 11.8%TE), which was reflected in plasma phospholipid fatty acid profiles. The modified diet successfully achieved the intended dietary targets, indicating effective dietary compliance.
population_specificity: Free-living UK participants at moderate risk for cardiovascular disease (n=54).
effective_dosage: Dietary targets: 16%TE SFA and 14%TE MUFA for the modified diet.
study_duration: Two 12-week intervention periods separated by an 8-week washout.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess how replacing carbohydrate with monounsaturated fat (MUFA) affects key metrics of glucose-insulin homeostasis, including HbA1c, post-challenge insulin, and insulin resistance.
results_summary: Replacing carbohydrate with MUFA lowered HbA1c (-0.09%), 2-hour post-challenge insulin (-20.3 pmol/L), and HOMA-IR (-2.4%), indicating improved glycemic control and insulin sensitivity. However, MUFA's effects were less consistent than PUFA's across outcomes.
population_specificity: Adults aged ≥18 years.
effective_dosage: 5% energy replacement from carbohydrate to MUFA.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether replacing saturated fats with monounsaturated fats (MUFA) in an AHA diet improves metabolic parameters more than polyunsaturated fats (PUFA) in individuals with metabolic syndrome.
results_summary: Both MUFA and PUFA diets led to weight loss, but PUFA showed greater reductions in triglycerides, blood pressure, and improved endothelial function compared to MUFA. MUFA had modest effects, with fewer participants converting to non-MetS status than PUFA.
population_specificity: Middle-aged men and women (mean age 60.8 years, 79% African-American, 60% women) with metabolic syndrome.
effective_dosage: Participants consumed 3 MUFA-enriched or PUFA-enriched muffins daily, with additional supplementation to ensure 25%-50% increases in dietary fat intake from these sources.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate associations between clock gene methylation, obesity, metabolic syndrome, and dietary intake of monounsaturated and polyunsaturated fatty acids.
results_summary: The study found associations between methylation levels of specific CLOCK gene CpG sites (1 and 8) and the intake of monounsaturated and polyunsaturated fatty acids, suggesting a potential link between dietary fats and epigenetic regulation of circadian clock genes.
population_specificity: Sixty normal-weight, overweight, and obese women.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of a high-oleic acid diet (HO) versus a standard grain and soy diet (CONTROL) on fatty acid composition, carcass quality, and meat suitability in pigs.
results_summary: The study found that the HO diet increased total monounsaturated fatty acids by 6.9% and reduced polyunsaturated fatty acids by 9.3% in subcutaneous fat without negatively affecting carcass quality or ham processing suitability. Intramuscular fatty acid composition remained largely similar between diets.
population_specificity: Fifty-seven York-crossed barrows and gilts (pigs).
effective_dosage: Not specified (diet enriched with oleic acid, 43% C18:1).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how monounsaturated fat (MUFA) affects triglyceride-rich lipoprotein (TRL) metabolism, specifically the roles of apolipoproteins E and C-III.
results_summary: The MUFA-rich diet increased secretion and rapid clearance of TRLs containing apo E and apo C-III while reducing secretion of TRLs without these apolipoproteins, which are major precursors of LDL. It also enhanced TRL fractional catabolic rate and shifted metabolism toward clearance rather than LDL conversion.
population_specificity: Twelve adults
effective_dosage: 24% MUFAs in the MUFA-rich diet (vs. 8% in the carbohydrate-rich diet)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of a diet rich in oleic acid (from olive industry by-products) versus a grain and soy diet on carcass characteristics, meat quality, and fatty acid profiles in pigs.
results_summary: The study found that pigs fed the high-oleic acid diet had higher monounsaturated fat (MUFA) and lower polyunsaturated fat (PUFA) in intramuscular and subcutaneous fat, with improved fat depot quality. No significant effects were observed on primal cut yields or meat quality characteristics.
population_specificity: Landrace *Large White *Pietrain barrows and gilts (pigs).
effective_dosage: 1.4% during growing phase, 3.8% during finishing phase.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of a high-monounsaturated fat diet, a low-fat diet, and a typical Western diet on insulin resistance and glucose tolerance after weight loss.
results_summary: The high-monounsaturated fat diet (MUFA) improved fasting glucose, insulin levels, and insulin resistance more effectively than the low-fat and control diets, though no significant differences were observed in glucose or insulin responses during an oral-glucose-tolerance test.
population_specificity: 46 nondiabetic, obese men (n=20) and premenopausal women (n=26) with a mean BMI of 31.2.
effective_dosage: MUFA diet provided 35-45% of energy from fat, with >20% from monounsaturated fatty acids.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of high-carbohydrate diets versus high-cis-monounsaturated fat diets on blood pressure to inform dietary recommendations.
results_summary: Diets rich in carbohydrate resulted in slightly higher systolic and diastolic blood pressure compared to diets rich in cis-monounsaturated fat, though the differences were not always statistically significant. The magnitude of the difference may not justify altering dietary recommendations for blood pressure management.
population_specificity: Subjects in intervention studies with stable body weight (specific demographics not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of a monounsaturated fat-rich diet (Mediterranean diet) with saturated fat and carbohydrate-rich diets on fat distribution, insulin sensitivity, and adiponectin gene expression in insulin-resistant individuals.
results_summary: The study found that a monounsaturated fat-rich diet prevented central fat redistribution and maintained higher insulin sensitivity and peripheral adiponectin gene expression compared to a carbohydrate-rich diet, while showing no significant differences in weight or body composition.
population_specificity: Eleven insulin-resistant offspring of obese type 2 diabetic patients with abdominal fat deposition.
effective_dosage: Not specified (diet composition described as "rich in monounsaturated fat").

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of olive oil (a monounsaturated fat source) on hepatic lipid content and oxidative stress parameters in rats with experimental non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD).
results_summary: Olive oil reduced hepatic triglyceride accumulation by 30% compared to the methionine choline-deficient diet (MCDD) group and showed lower oxidative stress compared to other fat sources, though it did not provide the greatest antioxidant activity.
population_specificity: Sprague-Dawley rats with induced NAFLD.
effective_dosage: Not specified (diet enriched with olive oil).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the inflammatory and coagulation marker responses to diets rich in cottonseed oil (high in n-6 polyunsaturated fats) versus olive oil (high in monounsaturated fats) in adults with untreated hypercholesterolemia.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in inflammatory or coagulation markers between the cottonseed oil and olive oil groups, suggesting that monounsaturated fats do not promote inflammation or coagulation compared to n-6 polyunsaturated fats in this population. Neither group showed changes in these markers over the 8-week intervention.
population_specificity: Sedentary adults aged 30-75 years (62% women) with untreated hypercholesterolemia or elevated blood lipids and BMI >18.5.
effective_dosage: Approximately 30% of energy needs from olive oil (monounsaturated fat) for 8 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of a high-monounsaturated fatty acid (MUFA) diet versus a high-carbohydrate (CHO) diet on LDL oxidative resistance and metabolic control in individuals with Type 2 diabetes.
results_summary: The study found that both high-CHO and high-MUFA diets had similar effects on LDL oxidative resistance and metabolic control. However, the MUFA diet lowered VLDL-cholesterol by 35% and VLDL triglyceride by 16%, and was preferred by participants over the CHO diet.
population_specificity: Twenty-two men and women with Type 2 diabetes (mean age 61 years, HbA1c<8.0%).
effective_dosage: MUFA diet (40% energy from fat, primarily virgin olive oil).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of a monounsaturated-fat-enriched diet versus a high-carbohydrate low-fat diet on serum lycopene and other carotenoid concentrations.
results_summary: The study found that both diets significantly increased serum lycopene levels, with no statistically significant difference between them. Reductions in cryptoxanthin and alpha-carotene were observed, but no changes occurred for other carotenoids.
population_specificity: 13 healthy males aged 20-70 years in Melbourne, Australia.
